abstract.text: + e − collider with the SND detector the nuclear interaction length of K L meson in NaI(Tl) has been measured.
Its value is found to be 30-50 cm in the K L momentum range 0.11-0.48 GeV/c.
The results are compared with the values used in the simulation programs GEANT4 and UNIMOD.

body_text.text: Introduction
In the analysis of experimental data in the high-energy physics the Monte-Carlo (MC) simulation is widely used.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: There are known simulation packages, such as UNIMOD [1], GEANT3 [2], and GEANT4 [3], which successfully describe the physical processes of particles passage through the detector material.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Nevertheless, in some cases, the accuracy of the theoretical models and/or the experimental data used in simulation may be not sufficient.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Therefore, it is worthwhile to verify the simulation using new experimental data.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In e + e − annihilation into hadrons at the center-of-mass (c.m.) energies above 1 GeV the neutral kaons are intensively produced, e.g. in the process e + e − → K S K L .
body_text.section: Introduction
Introduction

body_text.text: Whereas K S meson decays rapidly via K S → ππ channel, the neutral K L meson, due to its much greater lifetime, passes through detector material and is absorbed due to the nuclear interaction.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Since kaons in the process (1.1) are producing in pairs, the K L meson can be tagged by the recoiled K S meson.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: This greatly facilitates the study of K L interaction with the detector material.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In this paper we use kaons from the reaction (1.1) to measure the K L nuclear interaction length in NaI(Tl) crystals in the momentum range from 0.11 to 0.48 GeV/c.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Experiment
The experiment on the study the e + e − → K S K L process was carried out at the VEPP-2M [4] e + e − collider with the SND detector [5] in the c.m. energy range √ s = 2E =0.98-1.38 GeV.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: The SND is a general purpose non-magnetic detector for low energy e + e − -colliders.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: In the center of the detector around the collider beam pipe a tracking system consisting of two drift chambers is installed.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: The main part of the SND is a three-layer spherical electromagnetic calorimeter based on 1640 NaI(Tl) crystals with the total weight 3.6 ton.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: The calorimeter covers the polar angle range 18
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: The crystal angular dimension is ∆θ = ∆φ = 9 • .
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: The radial positions of the calorimeter layers are shown in Fig. 3.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: The total calorimeter thickness for particles originating from the interaction region is 34.7 cm (13.4X 0 ), where X 0 is the radiation length equal to 2.6 cm for NaI(Tl).
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: Pairs of crystals of the two inner layers with thickness of 2.9 and 4.8X 0 are sealed in a common thin (0.1 mm) aluminum container.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: In the gap between the second and third calorimeter layers an aluminum supporting hemisphere is located.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: The scintillation light signals from the crystals are detected by vacuum phototriodes.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: Outside the calorimeter an iron absorber and a muon detector are placed.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: In this paper the data collected in the energy interval √ s =1.04-1.38 GeV with an integrated luminosity of 9.2 pb −1 are analyzed.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: These data were used previously to measure the e + e − → K S K L cross section [6].
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: In addition, the data recorded at the maximum of the φ (1020) resonance with an integrated luminosity of 0.5 pb −1 are used.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: The Monte-Carlo event generator for the e + e − → K S K L reaction used in this analysis includes radiative corrections [7].
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: In particular, an extra photon emitted by initial electrons is generated with the angular distribution modelled according to Ref.

Experiment

body_text.text: The e + e − → K S K L Born cross section needed to calculate the radiative corrections is taken from Ref.
body_text.section: Experiment
Experiment

body_text.text: The response of the SND detector is simulated using the UNIMOD package [1].
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: This package developed in BINP (Novosibirsk) in eighteens is functionally similar to the GEANT3 [2] simulation program.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: Special attention in UNIMOD is given to simulation of pion and kaon low-energy nuclear interactions.
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: Nuclear cross sections are calculated with the SCATTER program [9], while the nuclear reactions are simulated using the NUCRIN model [10].
body_text.section: Experiment

body_text.text: The simulation takes into account the variation of the detector and accelerator conditions (dead electronic channels, size of the interaction region, etc.) and beam-induced background photons and charged particles overlapping events of interest.

body_text.text: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events
The K S mesons from the process e + e − → K S K L decay inside the SND tracking system.
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: The decay  mode K S → π 0 π 0 → 4γ is chosen for K S reconstruction.
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: Therefore we select events containing at least four photons and no charged particles.
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: To eliminate the cosmic ray background, the veto from muon detector and the requirement that the fired calorimeter crystals do not lie along a straight line are used.
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: We combine four photons in an event to create a K S candidate.
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: Photons included into the K S candidate must be in the polar angle range 36 • < θ γ < 144 • and have the transverse energy profile in the calorimeter corresponding to the profile from single electromagnetic shower [11].
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: The four photons are kinematically fitted to the K S → π 0 π 0 → 4γ hypothesis.
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: The distribution of χ 2 of the kinematic fit is shown in Fig. 1 for data and simulated e + e − → K S K L events from the energy region √ s = 1.04 − 1.10 GeV, in which the background contribution is small.
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: If more than one K S candidate is found in an event, the candidate with the lowest χ 2 value is chosen.
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: For further analysis, events with χ 2 < 25 are selected.
body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.section: Selection of e + e − → K S K L events

body_text.text: The nuclear interaction length λ int is close to the thickness of the calorimeter sensitive volume L cal = 34.7 cm.

body_text.text: Conclusion
Using kaons from the reaction e + e − → K S K L we have measured the K L nuclear interaction length in NaI(Tl) in the K L energy (momentum) range from 0.51 (0.11) to 0.69 (0.48) GeV (GeV/c).
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: The data were collected by the SND detector at the VEPP-2M e + e − collider.
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: We did not find any other measurements of the K L nuclear length at such low momenta in literature.
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: The energy dependence of the K L nuclear interaction length measured in this work is shown in Fig. 5 in comparison with the nuclear lengths used in the UNIMOD [1] and GEANT4 [3] packages.
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: The nuclear length for GEANT4 is obtained using test simulation, in which K L mesons interact in a large block of NaI(Tl).
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: The λ MC int is calculated from the probability of K L disappearance in a thin layer of material.
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: Our data are in good agreement with UNIMOD.
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: The values of the nuclear length used in GEANT4 version 9.5 (the model of hadron physics FTFP_BERT [12]) contradict to the measured values at energies below 0.55 GeV.
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: The results of this work may be used to refine the K L nuclear cross section in GEANT4.
body_text.section: Conclusion
